title.rendered: Guidance for students on current and future delivery methods

content.rendered:
Home

Guidance for students on current and future delivery methods

Despite the recent announcements by the government, Regent College London will continue to teach all provisions digitally until September 2021.

The safety and wellbeing of the Regent College London community is our highest priority and we continue to monitor the situation, adopting the advice from Public Health England, to ensure the welfare of our staff, students and visitors.

Regent College London is implementing a five stage system (similar to the Government’s alert system) that will define what studying at Regent College London will be like as we transition from the current situation to future learning and teaching.

The stage that we are at will dictate which facilities and services will be open, and to what extent. As we have 5 sites across London (4 outer London campuses and one inner London campus), it may be that different sites are able to move to different levels and become COVID-secure at different stages. Your current decision to take up a course with us does not need to depend on the location of the campus for now. However, when the eventuality happens we will, as far as is possible, support the needs of the students and staff. This will also be done in a phased manner, so that if needed we can change behaviours, and take account of individual circumstances. Please note that sufficient notice will be given in the event that students are required to physically attend any of our campuses.

Teaching Delivery Campus Facilities Student Services
LEVEL 5 Lockdown All Teaching is delivered via Regent Digital Campus Facilities are closed All services are via Regent Digital, with new additional contact and arrangement methods in place
LEVEL 4 Initial lifting of Lockdown All Teaching is delivered via Regent Digital Campus Facilities are closed to students, but some sites may be opened for essential activities for staff All services are via Regent Digital, with new additional contact and arrangement methods in place
LEVEL 3 First stage of reopening All Teaching is delivered via Regent Digital Socially-distanced services may resume, including limited access to facilities All services are via Regent Digital, with new additional contact and arrangement methods in place, some socially-distanced activities
LEVEL 2 Second stage of reopening Some small group sessions to resume when safe, following COVID-secure guidelines, all other teaching via Regent Digital Delivery of socially distanced services and access to campus with a view to transitioning to
full operations		 Delivery of socially distanced services transitioning to full operations, however all services now fully enhanced and supported via Regent Digital, with new additional contact methods in place arrangements in place
LEVEL 1 Permanent State of future delivery All physical classes to resume, alongside a new digital flexible delivery model Return to normal service operation Return to normal service operation, alongside Regent Digital powered enhanced service

Regent College London – A holistic and safe learning experience powered by Regent Digital which takes account of our student typology and our London location

We are committed to delivering a holistic higher education experience in September 2020 by providing you with a clear message regarding how Regent Digital powered learning will operate. You will have opportunities to study and engage in person with our staff and other students in a Regent Digital environment. This information confirms how you will learn and be taught when you start your course with us.

Face to face teaching – maintaining social distancing in a COVID- secure environment
Any face to face teaching on campus is likely to be in smaller groups where possible. Lectures that are suitable for the virtual environment will be delivered via Regent Digital.

Digital Teaching Delivery
Our online and any future on-campus delivery will utilise adaptive teaching and learning techniques while taking advantage of the state-of-the-art learning technologies, powered by Regent Digital. This will enable us to customise teaching, learning and personal tutoring to suit your individual learning needs. Our online learning tools are already tried and tested with our students and we provide materials and e-book and e-journal access to allow you to learn in your own time outside the classroom.

Personal Tutoring and Student Services
When you join the Regent College London community, you are inducted and introduced to key staff within Student Services but also within the academic team including Directors of Studies, Programme Leaders or Cohort Leaders who will look after your academic journey and welfare. Any one-to-one sessions will be either on-campus or remotely via video call, depending on the stage each site is at for attendance. Our outstanding student services team will also be accessible on-campus via our campus student experience champions and remotely by our wider Student Services Team depending on the specific need.

Social and Peer Learning Environments
We know that learning also takes place beyond the classrooms. That’s why we are also creating Regent Digital social learning zones for you to carry out group work, meet with other students, and make the most of higher education life.

*Regent College London is working to ensure that the current regulations that are in force are adhered to at all times, and that health and safety standards for dealing with the ongoing pandemic and Government advice are followed. Should this change as per Government, PHE and other regulatory guidelines, we will advise applicants and students as soon as possible. Regent College London remains committed to providing accessible learning and teaching for all our students and for those unable to attend on campus for reasons relating to COVID-19, alternative arrangements will be made. This information applies to Regent College London’s 5 sites.
